intro: Agretta pallideflavens, commonly known as the pale yellow agretta, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish to pale golden flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, providing a distinctive appearance. Agretta pallideflavens is often found in coastal and inland dunes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
